HEY HO FOLKS! Tony Newton/ Chooky here, finially! Since Nate created the Foolproof BLOG my PC/ modem have completely died in the arse! So with no way till NOW to log on - I have missed out on a few things...but now here I am! The 3rd & final founder of Foolproof Comics - comin atcha loud & clear...or something. Also seeing as I have limited access to the net, will try & add heaps when i can, but there could well be large chunks of the BLOG without any updates from me, so heres heaps to start with: Now, firstly thanks to Nate for scanning my piccys...so 2 were in drag, they are off to a media type firm so hell, might as well - who cares what i looked like for a day. If i scam a single job outta it all - it will have been worth it...(WASTED 30 mins of your life scanning pics of me? wow, ta so very much) Secondly looking forward to the new site (hopefully it wont be too long before i can get my PC back up & running, hopefully to help out) - dont do games if its gunna be a difficult & lengthy process, but wallpapers are not so bad. They might not be anywhere as good as Nates but I have heaps on my site i'm quite proud of. Thirdly the next issue 'Monkey Buisness'...if all that is really wrong is a few panels to the end, edit em. I think I have done pretty well what with my odd current anti-technology sphere active blowing almost all aspects of my PC to buggery. I look forward to seeing the whole thing done. Yes I can log on to the blog, i only asked for the re-invite once over a week ago, used 1 of 9 to get here & the only reason i mentioned my '2 days of net access left' was it was true, if i didnt get it now I wouldnt have been able to log on at all for ages. So yes, rage-boy, i still wanna join da BLOG. Fruit Loops? I agree with Nathan on this one - bleagh! try coco-pops next time...I have a recipe to use em in a smoothy - just like a chocolate milkshake...only...well it is. PS Jay-man, thanks for being surrogate printing man while I am currently unable to deplete other firms printing resources. NOW with all my replys done - news for Foolproof. Turkey Squad still to be done up, will try & scan @ a KINKOS & burn to CD to do at home. For those that don't know - Turkey Squad is the cartoon our character (& mascot - i think...Nate - confirm or deny) Fool watches. 1st episode drawn by yours truly coming soonish! Also am working on the script for the SuburbanKnights Radio Play - An Adventure In Music (hopefully to come to fruition in Feb 04 on FBi radio - 94.5FM), so news as it breaks there. WHEW! dats all for me for a while - e-chat later - TONY

So angry!! Well not angry disgruntled. Just got an email back from a job I applied for, the job was pretty much reproduction using Corel and Illustrator, something I can do standing on my head. I CAN DO ANYTHING!

I just saw some bastard run a dog over and not stop to check on the animals condition. I stopped the car a man who lived on the street came out and carried the injured animal to the footpath. His wife called the local council to get a ranger out to pick up the animal. The little guy had a collar and the man and his family said that someone owned the dog. Earlier today on the way to work with my Dad I spotted a large dog that had been hit and died. I hope that there isn't some asshole who's deliberately running dogs down. On a lighter note I caught up with old friends and realised that maybe I'd out grown them. There's an interesting thread on porno comics at the urlLink ozcomics messageboards at the moment. It started off with the usual jocular approach to this subject, it started get interesting when the topic was being debated in depth. It's sort of evolved into a pissing contest over, "what is art?" all because some guy aired his opinion on a few creators. The catalyst for this argument may or may not be right in his opinion but he's being ganged up on by two writers. It's a joke. So the guy doesn't like "writer X", big fucking deal. He has every right to say it and you have every right to say otherwise, but ganging up come on! In an open forum are we not allowed to ask questions? Push boundaries? Because that's what art is all about! Now I don't share the catalyst's point of view but I'm not going to hassle the shit out of the guy for saying whats on his mind. May I also point out that the catalyst may change his opinion somewhere down the line. Or are we going to attack him then and remind him of his previous comments? I realise I should be saying this on the forums but I think I'll shouted down.

Nate: So noted, thanks. Not much chance of it happening, but with my luck... Anyway, I went to the Central Coast on the weekend, and all that it implies. Anyone who knows me knows I'm not Beach Guy, but after spending some time there, I have to say...I just DON'T GET IT. The sand is too hot, the water is too cold and there are too many fat ugly people showing too much skin. Before you go, you have to smear on a foul-smelling goop, and if you miss any parts (because who can reach every part of their own body?) you wind up with bits of skin that resemble a strawberries-and-cream chuppa chup. Then the wind comes up, kicks up the sand and now you look like a cinnamon doughnut. And the sea is full of smelly weed and Things That Want To Hurt You. The whole thing is nuts.

The Black Beastie Writing Box is up and running, sitting pretty on a budget desk from K-Mart (which, frankly, took me longer to put together than the computer). And already my Game Cube is feeling neglected. Last night I awoke to a faint electronic voice from the lounge room singing "What About Me?". Cube needs a talking to. I almost watched Final Destination 2 last night. That is to say, I rented it and then read comics the whole time it was on. It got me to thinking about the premise of the first one. Does anybody really think that Death is so impatient and petty that if he misses you with a plane crash one day, he gets you with a Rube Goldberg device the next? Death is eternal! If you don't die in the crash, he just shrugs and sticks his bony finger up your butt. 10 years later, you die of prostate cancer.

It's in my car! Whoo hoo! Now I have to buy a desk after work tonight, but THEN...I'll be plugged in, turned on and ready to go. Also I have discovered a perfect spot in the lounge room which will not only be a nice little place for a computer desk, but will stop Tony hitting his head on my kitchen counter every time he comes over. Which is probably a good thing. Probably.

Oh, I forgot to mention the one that got me started in the first place. 4) They screwed our farmers in this new trade deal. No, no, no. That was the guy WE voted in that did that. He just bent us over and let them fuck us. And where the Hell is my computer?!?

I'm a little tired of how cool it seems to get on the "I hate Americans" bandwagon. I'm especially tired of people's reasons. 1) Their President is an idiot. This is true, but a majority of Americans did not vote for him. 2) They started a war with no good reason. Actually the abovementioned idiot did that, with very little support from his citizens. Support for the war only went up after it started because people wanted to support the troops. 3) They invented reality TV. Nope, that was the Dutch. America just stole the ides. Then WE stole it from them. There are more, but time and space don't allow me to continue. If you want to go on hating Americans, that's fine. Just don't let me catch you singing along with an American song, or watching thier shows, or reading their books etc. I'm not waving the American flag, or trying to be an arse kisser. I just know that racism still counts when your target is white.

"The Returner" is much better subbed, the psycho bad guy sounds, "badder" than his American voice over, who just comes off as a weenie who likes pregnant pauses. I agree Double Dash is a very seductive game, I am trying not to give into temptation and buy the game ... but it's calling me with it's suhweet siren song... Pablo Z Z bwah ha ha ha ha!

What does "despatched locally" mean? Dell says my computer has been despatched locally. It can't be too local, or it would be here by now. If I had any patience to begin with, I'd have run out by now. And yes, "Batman" will rock. Harder than two rocks in a rocking contest, I dare say. I started watching "The Returner" last night, before Double Dash lured me away. Not a bad movie but a veeery bad script (the English version, anyway). So far my favourite line is "Wait a minute...Is that a spaceship in disguise?" If that guy hadn't stood around wondering about it, he might still be alive.

Pablo Z Z. hee hee hee.... Meanwhile in Nateville... Nate learns JavaScript and plans to take over the world. Only one thing stands in his way... Jamie Oliver who will meet a violent end via a large cast iron fry pan and cooking spray. Ouch.

I'm not one to believe movie rumours before the movie happens BUT...If any of the following names are associated with the new Superman movie, blood will flow: 1) McG 2) Drew Barrymore 3) Ashton Kutcher 4) Bionce Knowles Just thought I'd let the world know. Wait, I'm sorry. My rant is not yet over. Who's fucking ridiculous idea was it to mention ANY of these people during a meeting about a Superman movie?!? I mean...I've heard of some stupid shit but...Johnny Depp as Lex Luthor? What the hell? Then I read somewhere on the 'net that they don't need to do a new Superman movie because we already have 'Smallville'. Well, newsflash dickhead, 'Smallville' sucks. Lex was not bald in high school and he did NOT live in Smallville. Anyone who doesn't know that oughta keep his mouth shut on issues regarding Superman.
He He He..take THAT FalsePablo! I hope they never find the body!

Uhhhhh huh....Well, OK then.... I had something to say, but Pablo's rant kinda threw me. Seems Smokescreen's quite popular. I can't say I'm all that impressed with Dell's "tracking" system. It's been a week since I placed my order and, so far, all they can tell me is that I've placed an order - and paid for it. This much I knew guys, thanks. I have a chair so far, but no desk. I'm considering just turning over the box it came in. It's a new interior design school I'm calling 'Hobo chic".
Screw this, I'm off to have a taco...

crap! misspelled repetitive!

FUCK! SHIT! FUCK! FUCK! I HATE YOU FALSE PABLO!

HUH.. Oh, well...I guess I shouldn't have gone off, as it appears that I'm just "Pablo" on this post, which is a good thing. On a related topic, I'm not sure what "woking had" is, but it sounds TASTY!

Yaay! Finally on! I had to pick PabloZ because some ***JERK*** (Yes, I'm talikng to you jerkface) is called Pablo (if you are reading this - HATE YOU AND I HOPE YOU DIE!). So it was a choice between PabloZ, PabloballZ and Zublander....I think I made the right choice. In other news I got a transformer for X-mas (I'm calling it X-mas because some asshole probably took that name too - ARE YOU HAPPY ASSHOLE!?!?!). Anyway it was the first transformer I got in something like 15 years. I got the WRX guy. He's cool. Ha ha ha what makes you think that will happen Jason? Meanwhile... That job I didn't get is advertising for the exact same job, exact same position. It's insane! Congrats Jase! My quest for employment continues. I've emailed editors about freelance work, they're happy enough to see the stuff but I'm usually not working in a style that seems applicable to the content of their magazines. At this rate I'll be doing illustrations for Picture magazine. I will forge on!

OK. I just bought my Dell online. Well done, me. The last question on the order form is - and I'm serious here - "Will the product(s) be used in conjunction with weapons of mass destruction, eg: nuclear weapons, chemical or biological weapons etc.?" What unmitigated dickhead of a terrorist is going to click "Yes"? I pity the goofball who thinks it's funny to answer that one with "Yes" just to be a smart arse.
Big announcement coming soon. I think I know one person who'll be pleased to hear it.
Jase I didn't even get the idea part just the, "I got the idea from..." No sausage sizzle at Parra hmm. They did in Guildford and I only had to wait for 5 minutes before voting :-p

Tony was having one of his can't-differentiate-between-an- idea -and-a- good idea moments. I'll let him explain, because frankly I'm trying to forget it. OK - Haven't blogged in a couple of days (but the doctor gave me some....oh never mind, I couldn't be bothered with that joke). I had a whole rant devised about the distinct lack of sausage sizzles at voting venues this year, before we were interrupted by "the unpleasantness". Suffice it to say that after walking from my place to Rose Hill, waiting in line for 20 minutes to be told to go elsewhere, then walking to and standing in line for over an hour at Parramatta Town Hall, I could really have used a sausage. Just a little meat-byproduct in an intestinal casing, burnt on a dirty grille, and slapped on some bread to raise money for the kids. Too hard people? Everyone's remembered Fletch's little shindig on Sunday right? There'll be sausages there, won't there?
Did anyone get a SMS from Tony that wasn't quite right? Tony what idea did you get from Queer Eye? (Personally I've had enough of that show) Make sense dammit! :-\
Play the bloody game Newton! You'll see! You'll see, it's funny hil-freakin-larious it is!!!

Oh, PS - I have no idea how it all started, but the Con-thing seems rather over-the-top. I agree with Jason & we Foolproofers back our Nathan on this one...at least thats what i gather from the posts & emails. Enuff said already - lets get back to ludicrous posts about Transformers, Nintendos (by the way, I'd just like to add here it was rather quaint to watch Natey get all flustered about his N64 game 'Conkers Bad Fur Day' when the rest of us agreed it was rather amusing, but the cut scenes really sucked - the poms should stick to Python. Ahhhh) & inflatable moose-head merchandise & SK movies & taking over the woild...which I am sure we will do at some point. Oh - I am out of the Nintendo discussions the other 3 have as all I's got is my handy-dandy PS1. Can't wait for PS3 (I will just by-pass PS2) & the PSPortable later this year. WOO!

OK - Hi all, sorry for the delay in posting - I just dont get much e-time these days. Now, on to a few things -The SK Radio Play is steaming along nicely with confirmed air-time being 8pm-9pm Sunday April 25th - looking forward to it immensely! Have also worked out a nifty pic of the lads in circular CD-like fashion & will chuck an image on after Nathan shows me how. I look forward to seeing our next ish as the 8 pages I have seen WAY ROCKED & Nate is a bit of a legend there. Pabs - bring on our Noisy Minor & GRU Crew piccys! Jay...er...you have a nice new PC :) And finially - Nathan old chum...do you want the current images of the pants'less bunny (a concept short cartoon of a comic our character Fool may well read - Rabbit Vs Chicken) or the newer version I am working on with MUCH better/ simpler backgrounds? Am also doing new Turkey Squad backgrounds (that is the cartoon Fool watches) so will get em done as soon as i can. Do you want ruff bios on Turkey Squad & RvC with pics for the site? Well that's all from Yours Truly the Chook-meister, will e-chat again later my Foolproof folks! :)
Please note: The comments made by me are not the opinions of Foolproof Comics. Nate

entry: Haven't got a sense of humor, have you? This coming from a guy who's supposed to be doing funny books. You've got some nerve calling me and my comic hack, when you obviously couldnt do any better. I've seen your comic, I've bought some crap in my time and your book was one of them. I dont even see any memorable characters in your Suburban knights comic.Nothing that will get to the legendary status of the Simpsons or Bugs Bunny. And is that all you can come up with, just S.K? Let's see if you can come up with more comedy characters plus serious superheroes as well! So I'd be very careful if I was you, since you dont know me and haven't seen the rest of my drawings and creations! One more thing. You say I ape other artists, when you are doing the same thing with saturday morning cartoons.You can e-mail me back, or we can have a fist to face chat outside Phantom Zone (Parramatta). Con it is now public record that you have threatened my person. Your a tool and I'm just going to ignore you.

"And there's that ridiculous "Fab 5" thread started by some hack who has the audacity to "use" my name ("nicky sohappy", did you spend a day on coming up with that?) amongst other australian comic guys for "quotes" in his comic. Not only is that thread the most useless thing, Alex - "Apple Head" has decided to out me as being gay. Which is a problem seeing as I'm not gay." The guy I called a hack has his panties in a twist over this comment. I originally retracted the comment but now I'm reinstating it. Why? Because I said it and it's already out there and maybe it was a bit of an overreaction but the guy parodied my surname - something I really hate - and used this "sohappy" and other Aussie comic guys to "endorse" his comic. Perhaps if he had asked and sent me a few sample pages I might have endorsed it. He didn't and he pissed me off.
Alright! We're in direct competition with Matt. Let the violence begin.
Tony, I want a copy of your comic with the pantless bunny.

Here's an email from my brother Matt to our hotmail address. He's got a table at the con with some of his friends (they'll let anyone have a table) - they've got some very wacky things going on... entry: I hope you guys don't mind fan mail from people you know, I guess you could take it as either encouraging or disheartening, but I know if it wasn't for Kylie, the Rock and Roll Ninja Aquarius e-mail account would be empty but for messages from my lecturers and stuff about mortgage rates. I figure, your comic costs two bucks, our comic costs two bucks, so we should just swap copies at the con, if that doesn't sound like too much of a... con. Badoom-cha. Well, I'll let you get back to work, I've got two pages to got, but I'm lowering my standards so fast that if I wait another week I'll be able to just get mum to do them. Ciao. p.s. Did you hear its going to be a Tolkien/Kung-Fu overrun event this year? I don't see too many people buying David Carradine autobiographies AND badly drawn comics about overweight manic-depressive radioactive ninjas. We might do a limited run of 3 copies this month, so we can keep telling ourselves that we could have done so much more. Okay, I better skidaddle. Matt.

There's a brothel between my place and Parramatta shops. They've been doing renovations for the past month or so. As I was walking past last night, I saw a sign on the door, which was closed. The sign said "Brand New Entrance". And I thought, "That's not something every brothel can offer...."
Made me a little woozy. No way am I looking at the actual photographs.
Pablo led me to urlLink virtual knee surgery . It's icky fun, kids!
urlLink Foolproof comics http://home.pacific.net.au/~maju/index.html remember it!

I saw The Butterfly Effect last night (my little sister's an Ashton Kutcher fan). It was really not as bad as I'd expected. A time travel story with no time machine was refreshing. Not to give anything away but...."Dude, where's my arms?" Heh heh heh.

See, I told you those villagers would come in handy. I said "Let's get some villagers!", but you were, like, "No way man!" Y'know how you get songs stuck in your head? Yesterday it was Scatterbrain's "I'm With Stupid", today it's "Peaches" by the Presidents. Stupidest songs of the '90s right here on JDB FM.

"Nate's not gay. C'mon, have you seen the way he dresses? ;)" Good point Jase, I'm a slob! Almost finished the backgrounds in the first 8 pages. Will pencil the next 8 soon, so it looks like the comic will be ready mid-April! Out of frame: The Villagers go: "Yay!"

Wow. If you don't read the Blog for a few days all sorts of things happen! Nate's not gay. C'mon, have you seen the way he dresses? ;) Fantastic backgrounds there, though. Saw Once Upon a Time in Mexico on the weekend. Not too shabby, even if it does have Enrique Iglesias in it. And I bought 1001 Movies You Should See Before You Die (because heaven has no DVD stores). Not a bad reference tool, but it is missing some obvious inclusions: Superman , Baraka , Shrek , The Truman Show and Dark City among them, in my opinion. And Meet the Parents made the list? Do you really need to see that? Titanic ? You don't need to see that before you die, it's on a continuous loop in Hell.

Geez! You change your user name on a message board from sohardi to soehardi (the actual correct spelling of my surname!) and people think there's two of you, me - WHATEVER! And there's that ridiculous "Fab 5" thread started by some hack who has the audacity to "use" my name ("nicky sohappy", did you spend a day on coming up with that?) amongst other australian comic guys for "quotes" in his comic. Not only is that thread the most useless thing, Alex - "Apple Head" has decided to out me as being gay. Which is a problem seeing as I'm not gay.

5 pages of backgrounds done. Start on radio play poster soonish. I think if I get this thing done mid april we'll be laughing. BTW urlLink Foolproof comics site has been updated. More updating tomorrow will add desktops yess... Here's the backgrounds for page 5 nice eh?
Yay! Transformers Energon figures released today!
Hey! NO...wait..it IS my fault! and I'm PROUD of it!

I'll show you how to fix that, which might have to be soon seeing as the con is thundering down on us like a stampede of suicidal lemmings - >sob Being really unorthodox doing backgrounds in vector and the characters by hand. It's experimental and if people turn on us? It's Pablo's fault =p On a good note my mother is gonna make a stuffed SuburbanKnight doll, hopefully by the con.

I never touched her! Oh... that . I've figured out how to do ovals for speech bubbles and rectangles for captions. I still have to work out how to do those little pointy thingamajigs, so we can tell who's doing the talking. And some other minor stuff, like if I need to do a sentence all in lower case. I can't stop it from automatically changing the first letter to a cap. But I will...and when I do...BAM!!
4 pages pencilled. When I hit 10 Jason, you'll start getting pages to letter, so I hope you've been messing about with corel.
Noted and done. Back to the mindless prattle: I saw some pics from Hidalgo . DC are you listening? VIGGO MORTENSEN AS JONAH HEX. Think about it.

Open comment to all foolproofers 6 weeks till the con . shit! tony draw the icons for the foldies, i will then trace them in corel and put the thing together. image for radio play comic tshirts other than that people - leave me alone. I mean it.

Call me a nerd (you have - and you will again) but I love it when they discover new things in space. Astronomers in California have discovered a planetoid about 8 billion light years from the sun and called it urlLink Sedna , after the Inuit sea-goddess. I love this stuff.
That decepticon is sooooo cool! I was a little disappointed to see it was another Viper, but at least they went to the effort of putting a roof on it. Sweet.

Well, the skin on my legs had grown back, so it was time to head back up the coast. But this time the Sun Gods were on my side and it was too gloomy to go to Mother Nuture's sandbox (except at night - which was cool, 'cause I got to do dangerous jumping-on-rocks-in-the-dark kinda things). And so, armed with my Sherlock Holmes book and the latest Incredible Hulk trade, I had a most relaxing weekend. If Shadowbolt was on Futurama, he'd be Dr. Zoidberg.

Created the SuburbanKnights: Monkey Business dummy book (re: mock-up) today. It clocks in at 16 pages and I'm mostly faithful to the script. I've only made one big change. The scene in the, "Rusty Steed" I've made it so Shadow Bolt makes the evil monkey hijinks instead of Fool. Poor Shadow Bolt he doesn't get enough screen time. Note: Mock-up does not mean I've drawn the book yet!
"McNuggets"
urlLink New Transformer Alternators Tracks looks awesome and there's a Decepticon in there! Swoon! =)

I hope you DO get beaten up at super speed. I've spent all morning singing about McNuggets, damn you. On an unrelated note, why are there so many trucks on the road? Surely they can come up with a way of moving shit around that won't get in my way on the way to and from work. Zepplins, maybe?

If so, that would make him the Bizzaro Reverse Flash, making him the 'Reverse-Reverse Flash', the two reverses completing a 360degree turn and therefore bringing us back to the original, which means you hung up on the Flash! What the hell were you thinking?! That guy could beat the shit out of all of us in under 2 seconds! Even if we were on separate continents! Which we're not!
I just spoke to a guy named Allen Barry. I thought maybe he was the Reverse Flash, so I hung up on him.
Whee! Our proverbial shit is getting together in a literal flurry...nay, ORGY! of activity! I'm so excited that I may even come to the meeting...and bring cookies!

Well of course I'm not your mother, Nate. The DNA test proved that years ago. Also...No vagina. Time to up the quantity? Let's do it. On a self-serving note, I need things for my editing portfolio, so the more, the better. Everyone is in agree ment . Agreeance was spelt right Tony, it's just not a real word, is all. You know there's a spell checker on here, right?

Yeah yeah... Your only bossing us around now? How long have we been at this?? I should listen to you because?? Anyways snide comments aside I just had a look at the ozcomics awards stuff and we're not listed anywhere. I say we go with the plan shorter stories more out put and less of the telling each other what to do and treating each others contribution casually. It takes time to write a script and it takes time to draw a page. Also the display for the con? I've got some templates that we can use.

HEY HEY folks...back for a wee-bit & some spiffy typing type action! Yep, we gots work to do lads...glad to see we are all in agreeance (is that spelled right...jason, you are the editor - let me know). also...if jay & i are like watson & holmes - which is which? 'He was bludgeoned to death with a blunt excrement' - Sherlock Holmes - WITHOUT A CLUE... 'what do you see when you look at the stars Watson? - stars, philosophy, astrology, astronomy, or the fact our f**king tent has been stolen?' - Sherlock Holmes gag. Still - looking forward to the HEAP of stuff we are doing for Foolproof/ SK soon - its gunna rock!
your not my mom. I've always wanted to say that. Anyway I'm doing it now. Got my belly flop comics from the printer's today... swuheet.
Nate's right. (Tony too, in his email). We've got some work to do....

Aah but there can only be one Watson =P I've unlocked the Trophy cart and all the characters can access it! Third try at the printers today to get my comic printed but I hadn't laid it out properly. Curses! The guy was fairly helpful and put together a mock up of the book. I must get started on Monkey business asap. And before Tony or anyone gives out any smart arsed comments remember the script to monkey business is still missing the interogation scene...

I started reading the Wordsworth Classics reprints of the old Sherlock Holmes stories last night. Man, the type is tiny . There are 2 columns to the page, and the page is not that big. I'm not a quick reader (compulsively editing as I go doesn't help), but I was reading for maybe 2 hours and got friggin' nowhere! Still, I'm a big fan of Arthur Conan Doyle's work (note for bookstore owners - that comes under 'C' not 'D', I had trouble finding them). Holmes and Watson met the same way Tony and I did. They both needed a flat-mate, and were introduced by a mutual friend.

I was sick yesterday. Not a cold, more of a practice-for-Mexico, don't-move-too-far-from-the-bathroom kinda thing. And now I have a headache that would kill a brown dog. What a healthy little gang we are.

I have a cold. So... much... mucus... Everything organised for my first venture into self publishing. Now I have to organise the exhibition SuburbanKnights Monkey Business and Radio Play... let's not forget the plot devices... I'll go die now.

Everyone's been so busy, it seems... My trip's all paid up and now I'm shopping for things to take. I want an I-pod. Bad. But judging by the prices it'll be cheaper to get o/s than here. So I'll have it for the trip home, at least. I bought Sideswipe, too. Now I know what Professor Rubik started doing when sales of his cube dropped. Whew!

Well - Hi there folks, how goes it? The radio play 'SK:An Adventure In Music' was a pretty decent success! I have heard only good feedback, even some who may wanna buy a copy somehow! Well Nate is stressing & behind his own 8-ball to get the comic done on time for the con this year...again, bless his heart :) Cover is done & away to Pablo for colour printing & the 16-pages are done, just require completion, printing & a trip to Jay's woik-place to copy lots of. The foldies are at a snag point after nate cant get em done & as you read below, the words are missing - so i am off home to do em by hand & with any luck, Sandra (my lovely fiance) can copy em at her work tomorrow! I look forward to the con & all that 2004 will bring to the continuing glory that IS Foolproof Comics! PS - I was given details a little while ago of a joint FBi Radio/ Sydney Opera House submission/ comp/ thingy for radio plays to be done LIVE at the Opera House in Sept & we are shortlisted for inclusion with 'SK:An Adventure In Music'! News as it breaks folks!

Well, it's coming down to crunch time for Supanova and everything that can go wrong is rearing its ugly head. The good photocopier in my office isn't working. Tony's gonna be stuck in Doonside, and if Pablo doesn't get some...er...relief, well, let's just say I don't want to sit next to him at the con. I goofed the transfer of the foldie word files, so they're gonna have to wait until tomorrow.

Maybe, but I have a lovely backyard. Anyway...Y'know what's fun? Dialoguing/lettering a comic without a script. Especially when, for some reason, my computer kept booting me out of Correll. 7 of 16 pages finished, but without a script, the rest could degenerate into madness. The bad kind of madness, not the kind we usually do. Plus, I've finally written my little "Community Service Announcement" as well.
Jason, you burke :-p
This is the last time I ink SuburbanKnights with a brush. It's not the tight line work I'm after. Planning a few minor csmetic changes with the characters.

I was on my way back from buying a printer dock for my new camera when I heard Mark Silverstri on FBI. When the interview was over I turned off the radio !! I totally missed Tony's interview! If anyone's going to be on any kind of media, let me know!

Tony! Don't play down the radio event. Yeah the new version is a lot better. Ugh... Today was one of those days where I would like to bundle my family into a car and push them off a cliff. Anyway check out the cover sketch to Monkey Business. I'll have to draw the guys behind smaller or from a worms eye view.

Well folks...it's nearly time! Here I sit in FBI Studios ready to air the FINAL ammended SK Radio Play - 2 songs edited down, extra fx added, all seems to be a-goer! I will also be on air giving background guff & a plug for our gear at Supanova next weekend - so i will also bag a copy of that too. So, without further ado, i am off to make (hopefully) recording history! Wish me luck folks, & remember - this is my 1st time at this so if it's a bit rusty/ odd - i promise to do better next time...providing there IS a next time. I hope so, its been fun. Ciao y'all.
ATTENTION ALL - changes at FBI mean the radio play will be at 9PM & NOT 8pm. dats all.

hey folks...its D-DAY! the radio play airs tonight on FBI RADIO 94.5fm at 8pm...i write to you from FBI as a small interview is underway...& i write this in the very presence of MARK SILVESTRI! He too is here for a radio interview...WOO! After the 2nd listen of the radio play, it aint so bad...a few probs were hopefully fixed by JBJ thru the week - should be pretty cool. Anyhoo, my PC is now back to 80% capacity - all good BAR the damn net! so if i get it, i am away! so, i'm off to do the radio thing...e-chat soon & see you all at SUPANOVA in a week!
Sydneysiders this Sunday at 9:00pm SuburbanKnights: An Adventure In Music on Fbi Radio. You can find Fbi's programming schedule urlLink here. Fbi Radio's frequency is 94.5FM
We were talking last night about Alan Smithee films. Learn more about him urlLink here .

Anyway, a kid and his mother sat down next to me and the kid was wrapped with the Coltraine image, so I quickly drew him a sketch and gave it to him because my train had arrived. It should've been "rapt" instead of "wrapped" - ugh brain fart.

ordered something off the 'net yesterday. Waiting for the confirmation email - come on already! I have a plan to combat the "meh". Do this: Get your mum or sister to hire 28 Days Later for you. Tell them it's the sequel to Sandra Bullock's 28 Days... Oh wait we did this gag already.

I was messing about on trains on the weekend, as well. Went to Luna Park for a look around. Meh. The food is so expensive. Watched Welcome to the Jungle on DVD as well. Meh. So I'm looking to do something mucho interesting this weekend to make up for a fairly lackluster one just passed. Have to, have to , HAVE TO do my assignment this early this week, to leave time for lettering Monkey Business.

Went to the city yesterday to sell copies of Belly Flop to Kings Comics, valuable lesson learned: The guy who buys the local comics for Kings is instore during the week. Will have to go back Monday. I forgot to change trains and headed out to Hornsby and had to get off at Concord (nice area, quiet.) and go back to Strathfield. While waiting for the right train I decided to draw a new character I came up with, Tabby Coltrain. His surname is from Robby Coltraine ( Cracker and From Hell) because the character is quite big. Anyway, a kid and his mother sat down next to me and the kid was wrapped with the Coltraine image, so I quickly drew him a sketch and gave it to him because my train had arrived.
Holy crap my post from last night was butchered!! Read the LWF Icon thread urlLink here! Sender a letter of protest to Marvel urlLink here! Take that glitchy computer.

'V' is not for victory The saga of the friggin' white t-shirts continues. Tony bought some v-neck shirts for us to put designs on for the con. One each for the 4 of us. urlLink OzCommunity Forums - The Challenge begins! Website Launched and Registrations Open! THe OzComics 24 Hour Challenge is on next month Queens Birthday Long Weekend, anyway people are thinking way too much about the challenge. Seriously I haven't been worked up about things in a long time but the question about ruling pages (in challenge) it's moot. you've got a dealine 24 hours and a large chunk of it is taken up by page layout. Admittedly you need strategy, for me I know it's a smart thing to limit the panels per page 2s, 3s and 4s. As long as it doesn't go over 5 panels you should be ok. Hell your comic can be splash pages , it's okay. Limit your characters. 1 to 3 characters max, you're not creating the next LOTR in 24 hours (You may be inspired too though) face the fact that the art will not be up to code and get over it. You can work tightly but how much is too much? Why do I say this? Because the challenge is more than a gimmick to max comic output. It's a chance to loosen up and work freely. Those of you who work in studios that require you to work in a house style (You know who you are) - this is a break from that demand. Use it you'll be better for it. Working too tightly will suck the fun out of the challenge. Remember work smart, not hard and that it's 24 pages in 24 hours - there's no limit on panels.

urlLink OzCommunity Forums - Sell me Manga, I don't get it. The Manga debate has sparked again... Boring. All really revolves around is a lot of varying opinion and of course the occasional view that manga is superior to American mainstream or funny animal drawings. Annoying is what it is. Don't get me wrong, I like manga, I like anime. I just don't like manga and anime in that way. Yes, Ghost In The Shell is brilliant but what has it been followed by? Man Machine Interface and it's pretty ho hum. All I want to say is that anime's and manga's pool is pretty diluted too, for every FLCL there's 20 Love Hinas, for Ashen Victor there's 50 Dragonball Zs. It gets worse with the anime that gets screened on TV, apart from the mandatory bad dub it's Sailor Moon, DBZ, Yugi Oh, Pokemon etc. We don't see the good stuff , just what's marketable and sells.(re: a lot of crap out there.) It's no wonder we have people saying, " I don't like manga." All we've got is the endless regurgitation of bad ideas. Let's face it DBZ is a bad idea from the get go, it takes what was a charming story, an interpretation of the legend of the monkey king and reams it royally up the ass. The round friendly art was traded in for ugly, angular drawings. It takes half an episode to power up and eight episodes to finish a battle. I could now say, "what does this teach our kids?" but I'm not because it's more of a case of, "This is entertaining?" It could be worse though, remember when the company who did the original TMNT animation bought the rights to do a new Speed Race series? Let's not and say we did. Take an event like that and the strap it to an animated series and a trading card game...
GAH! What Happened to our Blog!?

Fat Stormtroopers, Brian Michael Bendis the Musical and an overdose of Stickfas aside, Supanova seemed to be a rousing success in general, but almost everyone I spoke to in Artist's alley seemed disappointed at AA's new location. Still, Supanova's still in it's infancy and complaining gets nothing accomplished. As for Foolproof. Well, we sold far fewer comics than last year. But through the marvels of creative accounting, we made about twice as much money. Go figure. Saw the latest Harry Potter on the weekend. I don't know if it's less impressive than the last two, or if I'm just becoming bored with the whole thing. It's well made, but...I don't know. I have the feeling these things are gonna go on for ever. I can imagine Harry growing up and leaving Hogwart's, only to return as a teacher in Welcome Back Potter . Nice to see the Ring Wraiths got work after Lord Of The Rings wrapped up, though. I'd been concerned that they'd been doomed to play Ghosts of Christmas Past, Grim Reapers and the like forever more. Whatever you do, don't see H.P. at the drive-in, though. Not that it makes any difference to the movie, but the second feature is Scooby Doo 2 . I have not the words to describe what I saw. If it had played out like a feature-length episode of the cartoon, then fine. If it had been animated, it might have rated a 3. But the whole movie seemed dedicated to ramming a message of "be yourself, you're better than you think" down your throat. I know it's a kid's movie, but when parents need Scooby Doo to teach their kids life lessons, I weep for the future.

My flag's at half mast. Ray Charles was a legend, and I will truly miss him. Ray was a master of R&B, Soul and Blues back went those words meant something. Back before, sometime in the late 80's/early 90's these genres merged into the lackluster, homogenised pulp passed off as R&B by people like R. Kelly and whatsisname, and that other guy. Blind since age 7, Ray Charles overcame adversities that would leave today's "R&B" stars curled in the foetal position moaning like imbeciles. He played music with a passion rarely seen today and he always looked like he was enjoying himself. Why are there no blind musicians any more? There were quite a few blind bluesmen, back in the day. You know why? Because semi-talented "musicians" are coddled and made palatable to the masses. No-one knows what to do with an independent spirit anymore. No-one knows how to handle someone who can - indeed HAS TO - do it all himself. Someone like Ray Charles. If you don't know what I'm talking about, I urge you to check Ray's stuff out. I know it's passe, but the beauty of that is that you can usually pick up his albums quite cheap. R&B stood for Rhythm and Blues. The real, depression-era, grass-root blues, with a slightly more up-beat tempo. Not the "I don't have enough money for drugs because I have seven court cases pending and one of my bitches up and took my Ferrari" crap doled out today by buffoons in sideways baseball caps and more gold than Mr. T in his prime. If you have any sense of music history, look at it this way - Without Ray Charles, there would be no Quincy Jones. Without Q, there's be no Michael Jackson. And without Mike, there'd be no R. Kelly, whatsisname or that other guy.

Posting from home today as I'm on holidays all this week. God bless the man who invented leave loading. It's like getting paid to NOT come to work. Anyway, a couple of things were bugging me since my trip up the coast on the weekend. Actually, they have more to do with the traveling part of the trip than the coast itself. Firstly: I think the RTA should put a moratorium on number plates proclaiming how HOT, COOL, SEXY, SXY or GR8 you think your car is. We've all seen 'em people, no-one cares any more (Special note to the guy in the Honda CR8 - GR8 CR8 says 'Great crate' to me, is that what you intended?). Secondly: Does anything suck as much as WSFM? W e S uck F or M oney actually played Kung Fu Fighting on the weekend without the slightest trace of irony. And does anyone want to hear Daddy Cool ever again? And they play a station promo that has some Westie lunkhead saying "You don't even need a record or CD collection any more because you have you guys". Putting aside the hideously improper use of pronouns, does this guy mean to say that, prior to ditching his CCR, BTO, LRB and ELO CD's (plus, undoubtedly, the Best of Queen and the soundtracks to Forrest Gump and The Big Chill )he would play, say, three songs in a row (ABBA, Fleetwood Mac and John Farnham) then stop to chat with his friends about frozen Indian Food, insurance and the newest Subway sandwich? OK, maybe he did.

Can't wait to check out the audio commentries and the Irkin subtitles.

I enjoyed I, Robot quite a bit more than I'd anticipated. I thought it would be a lot more Asimov-y, and there are parts of me that are still asleep due to prolonged exposure to Bicentennial Man . But it seems a little more comic book inspired, with a bit of manga thrown in. And there's a bit of subtext about slaves and slave races etc. that makes it a bit more interesting (although I'm still not sure it was entirely intentional). Anyway there is no - repeat, NO - Batman Begins trailer attached, at least not at Hoyts. Just Aliens Vs Predator , which could go either way, but since it was written by the guy who wrote Resident Evil , I'm gonna give it a go. Resident Evil is a Big Mac of a movie, it's not good for me, it's not even all that great - but there's something about it that I found strangely satisfying. It held no pretentions to being anything more than it was, and I hope AvP sticks with thatattitude. Basically, I just want to see a whole bunch of people die.

OK, I got so excited about being an ABC warrior, I forgot to copy their little blurb: In bars frequented by colossal death robots, you're always the quiet guy at the back who no-one ever bothers. And for good reason. You've fought in several nuclear wars, could beat the sun in a staring match, and have a chin larger than many articles of furniture. Morals are not a concept you understand, but strangely enough, nobody ever questions your judgement. Usually because they're dead. Even Judge Dredd wets himself when you turn up. Grrrr. I also learned a little more about them urlLink here . Alan Moore, Simon Bisley and Steve Dillon, oh my. Speaking of giant robots (and who else thought Tony would be C3PO?), I bought the 1st season of Transformers the other day and have been reliving my early years. I love Scatman Crothers, he got to be Jazz and Hong Kong Phooey. Nobody's cooler than that. These are the things you realise after not having seen the show for 20 odd years: Prime was seemingly based on John Wayne and Wheeljack was called Wheeljack even before he had wheels. And all the humans are annoying (although I did remember that). What else? The radio play nears completion.... Oh, and I saw Fahrenheit 911. I'm not going to start a political argument, but I do think anyone who feels uninformed about the war in Iraq should see at least the 2nd half. The first half covers a lot of what's in Dude, Where's My Country?, concerning the Bush/Bin Laden links in business matters and even a supporter of Michael Moore could see how it could be written off as hyperbole or exaggeration (it may not be either, though). But the second half concentrates on the war, and is told by the people it has effected most. Some very emotional and provocative stuff that might open the eyes of someone who might not have made a decision which way to vote yet. It does contain some rather graphic images, though. That doesn't mean don't see it, just be prepared, is all. One last thing, in case more people that I know of read this thing: I seem to have broken something that does not belong to me and have upset someone very dear to me in the process. So, if anyone has a Ginger from Chicken Run pull-string wriggler (from Hungry Jack's, back when the movie was out) that they want to be rid of, I would really appreciate an email at urlLink jason_buckley74@yahoo.com.au . Here's a urlLink pic of the Rocky toy , to jog your memory (I couldn't even find a Ginger picture!). It may just be my life you're saving.

I think I figured out what my problem with I, Robot is. Unlike Pablo, I have no anti-Will Smith feelings, and, not having seen Garage Days , I don't hold it against Alex Proyas. No, my problem is, as usual with me, far more obscure and petty. It's the word "robot". After years of dealing - cinematically - with Androids, Droids, Replicants and whatever-Bishop-from-Aliens-was, robot just doesn't hold the same weight as it used to. It always reminds me of two things: Those arm-with-a-claw-on-the-end things that build cars on assembly lines, and Futurama . I can imagine Dr, Zoidberg in Will Smith's part, waving his claws and shouting "There's something wrong with the rob'ts" Oh, and I'd finally gotten Safety Dance out of my head. Thanks for putting it right back in there.

I hardly think it's worth competing about who writes the most in the blog, Jase. I mean, sheer verbosity can hardly be cause for celebration. According to that logic we should award those who are as longwinded as possible and demerit those who hava a talent, nay an obligation to be succinct. I suppose that what I'm asking is; is it, in the end, the length of a final article or post to a blog or any form of media, mainstream or otherwise (you can write in curry on cheezles for all I care...as long as it's legible) that gives said article or post validity or 'weight'? Is Macbeth or The Versailles Treaty a greater written work than, say, Row Row Row Your Boat or Safety Dance ? For the sake of interest here are the first 26 articles of the Treaty of Versailles: THE COVENANT OF THE LEAGUE OF NATIONS. THE HIGH CONTRACTING PARTIES, In order to promote international co-operation and to achieve international peace and security by the acceptance of obligations not to resort to war by the prescription of open, just and honourable relations between nations by the firm establishment of the understandings of international law as the actual rule of conduct among Governments, and by the maintenance of justice and a scrupulous respect for all treaty obligations in the dealings of organised peoples with one another Agree to this Covenant of the League of Nations. ARTICLE I. The original Members of the League of Nations shall be those of the Signatories which are named in the Annex to this Covenant and also such of those other States named in the Annex as shall accede without reservation to this Covenant. Such accession shall be effected by a Declaration deposited with the Secretariat within two months of the coming into force of the Covenant Notice thereof shall be sent to all other Members of the League. Any fully self-governing State, Dominion, or Colony not named in the Annex may become a Member of the League if its admission is agreed to by two-thirds of the Assembly provided that it shall give effective guarantees of its sincere intention to observe its international obligations, and shall accept such regulations as may be prescribed by the League in regard to its military, naval, and air forces and armaments.Any Member of the League may, after two years' notice of its intention so to do, withdraw from the League, provided that all its international obligations and all its obligations under this Covenant shall have been fulfilled at the time of its withdrawal. ARTICLE 2. The action of the League under this Covenant shall be effected through the instrumentality of an Assembly and of a Council, with a permanent Secretariat. ARTICLE 3. The Assembly shall consist of Representatives of the Members of the League. The Assembly shall meet at stated intervals and from time to time as occasion may require at the Seat of the League or at such other place as may be decided upon.The Assembly may deal at its meetings with any matter within the sphere of action of the League or affecting the peace of the world. At meetings of the Assembly each Member of the League shall have one vote, and may not have more than three Representatives. ARTICLE 4. The Council shall consist of Representatives of the Principal Allied and Associated Powers, together with Representatives of four other Members of the League. These four Members of the League shall be selected by the Assembly from time to time in its discretion. Until the appointment of the Representatives of the four Members of the League first selected by the Assembly, Representatives of Belgium, Brazil, Spain, and Greece shall be members of the Council. With the approval of the majority of the Assembly, the Council may name additional Members of the League whose Representatives shall always be members of the Council; the Council with like approval may increase the number of Members of the League to be selected by the Assembly for representation on the Council. The Council shall meet from time to time as occasion may require, and at least once a year, at the Seat of the League, or at such other place as may be decided upon. The Council may deal at its meetings with any matter within the sphere of action of the League or affecting the peace of the world. Any Member of the League not represented on the Council shall be invited to send a Representative to sit as a member at any meeting of the Council during the consideration of matters specially affecting the interests of that Member of the League. At meetings of the Council, each Member of the League represented on the Council shall have one vote, and may have not more than one Representative. ARTICLE 5. Except where otherwise expressly provided in this Covenant or by the terms of the present Treaty, decisions at any meeting of the Assembly or of the Council shall require the agreement of all the Members of the League represented at the meeting. All matters of procedure at meetings of the Assembly or of the Council, including the appointment of Committees to investigate particular matters, shall be regulated by the Assembly or by the Council and may be decided by a majority of the Members of the League represented at the meeting. The first meeting of the Assembly and the first meeting of the Council shall be summoned by the President of the United States of America. ARTICLE 6. The permanent Secretariat shall be established at the Seat of the League. The Secretariat shall comprise a Secretary General and such secretaries and staff as may be required.The first Secretary General shall be the person named in the Annex; thereafter the Secretary General shall be appointed by the Council with the approval of the majority of the Assembly.The secretaries and staff of the Secretariat shall be appointed by the Secretary General with the approval of the Council.The Secretary General shall act in that capacity at all meetings qf the Assembly and of the Council.The expenses of the Secretariat shall be borne by the Members of the League in accordance with the apportionment of the expenses of the International Bureau of the Universal Postal Union. ARTICLE 7. The Seat of the League is established at Geneva. The Council may at any time decide that the Seat of the League shall be established elsewhere. All positions under or in connection with the League, including he Secretariat, shall be open equally to men and women. Representatives of the Members of the League and officials of he League when engaged on the business of the League shall enjoy diplomatic privileges and immunities.The buildings and other property occupied by the League or its officials or by Representatives attending its meetings sha11 be inviolable. ARTICLE 8. The Members of the League recognise that the maintenance of peace requires the reduction of national armaments to the lowest point consistent with national safety and the enforcement by common action of international obligations. The Council, taking account of the geographical situation and circumstances of each State, shall formulate plans for such reduction for the consideration and action of the several Governments. Such plans shall be subject to reconsideration and revision at least every ten years. After these plans shall have been adopted by the several Governments, the limits of armaments therein fixed shall not be exceeded without the concurrence of the Council. The Members of the League agree that the manufacture by private enterprise of munitions and implements of war is open to grave objections. The Council shall advise how the evil effects attendant upon such manufacture can be prevented, due regard being had to the necessities of those Members of the League which are not able to manufacture the munitions and implements of war necessary for their safety. The Members of the League undertake to interchange full and frank information as to the scale of their armaments, their military, naval, and air programmes and the condition of such of their industries as are adaptable to war-like purposes. ARTICLE 9. A permanent Commission shall be constituted to advise the Council on the execution of the provisions of Articles 1 and 8 and on military, naval, and air questions generally. ARTICLE 10. The Members of the League undertake to respect and preserve as against external aggression the territorial integrity and existing political independence of all Members of the League. In case of any such aggression or in case of any threat or danger of such aggression the Council shall advise upon the means by which this obligation shall be fulfilled. ARTICLE 11. Any war or threat of war, whether immediately affecting any of the Members of the League or not, is hereby declared a matter of concern to the whole League, and the League shall take any action tnat may be deemed wise and effectual to safeguard the peace of nations. In case any such emergency should arise the Secretary General shall on the request of any Member of the League forthwith summon a meeting of the Council. It is also declared to be the friendly right of each Member of the League to bring to the attention of the Assembly or of the Council any circumstance whatever affecting international relations which threatens to disturb international peace or the good understanding between nations upon which peace depends. ARTICLE 12. The Members of the League agree that if there should arise between them any dispute likely to lead to a rupture, they will submit the matter either to arbitration or to inquiry by the Council, and they agree in no case to resort to war until three months after the award by the arbitrators or the report by the Council. In any case under this Article the award of the arbitrators shall be made within a reasonable time, and the report of the Council shall be made within six months after the submission of the dispute. ARTICLE 13. The Members of the League agree that whenever any dispute shall arise between them which they recognise to be suitable for submission to arbitration and which cannot be satisfactorily settled by diplomacy, they will submit the whole subject-matter to arbitration. Disputes as to the interpretation of a treaty, as to any question of international law, as to the existence of any fact which if established would constitute a breach of any international obligation, or as to the extent and nature of the reparation to be made or any such breach, are declared to be among those which are generally suitable for submission to arbitration. For the consideration of any such dispute the court of arbitraion to which the case is referred shall be the Court agreed on by the parties to the dispute or stipulated in any convention existing between them. The Members of the League agree that they will carry out in full good faith any award that may be rendered, and that they will not resort to war against a Member of the League which complies therewith. In the event of any failure to carry out such an award, the Council shall propose what steps should be taken to give effect thereto. ARTICLE 14. The Council shall formulate and submit to the Members of the League for adoption plans for the establishment of a Permanent Court of International Justice. The Court shall be competent to hear and determine any dispute of an international character which the parties thereto submit to it. The Court may also give an advisory opinion upon any dispute or question referred to it by the Council or by the Assembly. ARTICLE 15. If there should arise between Members of the League any dispute likely to lead to a rupture, which is not submitted to arbitration in accordance with Article 13, the Members of the League agree that they will submit the matter to the Council. Any party to the dispute may effect such submission by giving notice of the existence of the dispute to the Secretary General, who will make all necessary arrangements for a full investigation and conside ation thereof. For this purpose the parties to the dispute will communicate to the Secretary General, as promptly as possible, statements of their case with all the relevant facts and papers, and the Council may forthwith direct the publication thereof. The Council shall endeavour to effect a settlement of the dispute, and if such efforts are successful, a statement shall be made public giving such facts and explanations regarding the dispute and the terms of settlement thereof as the Council may deem appropriate. If the dispute is not thus settled, the Council either unanimously or by a majority vote shall make and publish a report containing a statement of the facts of the dispute and the recommendations which are deemed just and proper in regard thereto Any Member of the League represented on the Council may make public a statement of the facts of the dispute and of its conclusions regarding the same. If a report by the Council is unanimously agreed to by the members thereof other than the Representatives of one or more of the parties to the dispute, the Members of the League agree that they will not go to war with any party to the dispute which complies with the recommendations of the report. If the Council fails to reach a report which is unanim~usly agreed to by the members thereof, other than the Representatives of one or more of the parties to the dispute, the Members of the League reserve to themselves the right to take such action as they shall consider necessary for the maintenance of right and justice. If the dispute between the parties is claimed by one of them, and is found by the Council, to arise out of a matter which by international law is solely within the domestic jurisdiction of that party, the Council shall so report, and shall make no recommendation as to its settlement. The Council may in any case under this Article refer the dispute to the Assembly. The dispute shall be so referred at the request of either party to the dispute, provided that such request be made within fourteen days after the submission of the dispute to the Council. In any case referred to the Assembly, all the provisions of this Article and of Article 12 relating to the action and powers of the Council shall apply to the action and powers of the Assembly, provided that a report made by the Assembly, if concurred in by the Representatives of those Members of the League represented on the Council and of a majority of the other Members of the League, exclusive in each case of the Rpresentatives of the parties to the dispute shall have the same force as a report by the Council concurred in by all the members thereof other than the Representatives of one or more of the parties to the dispute. ARTICLE 16. Should any Member of the League resort to war in disregard of its covenants under Articles 12, 13, or 15, it shall ipso facto be deemed to have committed an act of war against all other Members of the League, which hereby undertake immediately to subject it to the severance of all trade or financial relations, the prohibition of all intercourse between their nations and the nationals of the covenant-breaking State, and the prevention of all financial, commercial, or personal intercourse between the nationals of the covenant-breaking State and the nationals of any other State, whether a Member of the League or not. It shall be the duty of the Council in such case to recommend to the several Governments concerned what effective military, naval, or air force the Members of the League shall severally contribute to the armed forces to be used to protect the covenants of the League. The Members of the League agree, further, that they will mutually support one another in the financial and economic measures which are taken under this Article, in order to minimise the loss and inconvenience resulting from the above measures, and that they will mutually support one another in resisting any special measures aimed at one of their number by the covenantbreaking State, and that they will take the necessary steps to afford passage through their territory to the forces of any of the Members of the League which are co-operating to protect the covenants of the League. Any Member of the League which has violated any covenant of the League may be declared to be no longer a Member of the League by a vote of the Council concurred in by the Representatives of all the other Members of the League represented thereon. ARTICLE 17. In the event of a dispute between a Member of the League and a State which is not a Member of the League, or between States not Members of the League, the State or States, not Members of the League shall be invited to accept the obligations of membership in the League for the purposes of such dispute, upon such conditions as the Council may deem just. If such invitation is accepted, the provisions of Articles 12 to I6 inclusive shall be applied with such modifications as may be deemed necessary by the Council. Upon such invitation being given the Council shall immediately institute an inquiry into the circumstances of the dispute and recommend such action as may seem best and most effectual in the circumstances.If a State so invited shall refuse to accept the obligations of membership in the League for the purposes of such dispute, and shall resort to war against a Member of the League, the provisions of Article 16 shall be applicable as against the State taking such action. If both parties to the dispute when so invited refuse to accept the obligations of membership in the League for the purpose of such dispute, the Council may take such measures and make such recommendations as will prevent hostilities and will result in the settlement of the dispute. ARTICLE 18. Every treaty or international engagement entered into hereafter by any Member of the League shall be forthwith registered with the Secretariat and shall as soon as possible be published by it. No such treaty or international engagement shall be binding until so registered. ARTICLE 19. The Assembly may from time to time advise the reconsideration by Members of the League of treaties which have become inapplicable and the consideration of international conditions whose continuance might endanger the peace of the world. ARTICLE 20. The Members of the League severally agree that this Covenant is accepted as abrogating all obligations or understandings inter se which are inconsistent with the terms thereof, and solemnly undertake that they will not hereafter enter into any engagements inconsistent with the terms thereof. In case any Member of the League shall, before becoming a Member of the League, have undertaken any obligations inconsistent with the terms of this Covenant, it shall be the duty of such Member to take immediate steps to procure its release from such obligations. ARTICLE 21. Nothing in this Covenant shall be deemed to affect the validity of international engagements, such as treaties of arbitration or regional understandings like the Monroe doctrine, for securing the maintenance of peace. ARTICLE 22. To those colonies and territories which as a consequence of the late war have ceased to be under the sovereignty of the States which formerly governed them and which are inhabited by peoples not yet able to stand by themselves under the strenuous conditions of the modern world, there should be applied the principle that the well-being and development of such peoples form a sacred trust of civilisation and that securities for the performance of this trust should be embodied in this Covenant. The best method of giving practical effect to this principle is that the tutelage of such peoples should be entrusted to advanced nations who by reason of their resources, their experience or their geographical position can best undertake this responsibility, and who are willing to accept it, and that this tutelage should be exercised by them as Mandatories on behalf of the League. The character of the mandate must differ according to the stage of the development of the people, the geographical situation of the territory, its economic conditions, and other similar circumstances. Certain communities formerly belonging to the Turkish Empire have reached a stage of development where their existence as independent nations can be provisionally recognised subject to the rendering of administrative advice and assistance by a Mandatory until such time as they are able to stand alone. The wishes of these communities must be a principal consideration in the selection of the Mandatory. Other peoples, especially those of Central Africa, are at such a stage that the Mandatory must be responsible for the administration of the territory under conditions which will guarantee freedom of conscience and religion, subject only to the maintenance of public order and morals, the prohibition of abuses such as the slave trade, the arms traffic, and the liquor traffic, and the prevention of the establishment of fortifications or military and naval bases and of military training of the natives for other than police purposes and the defence of territory, and will also secure equal opportunities for the trade and commerce of other Members of the League. There are territories, such as South-West Africa and certain of the South Pacific Islands, which, owing to the sparseness of their population, or their small size, or their remoteness from the centres of civilisation, or their geographical contiguity to the territory of the Mandatory, and other circumstances, can be best administered under the laws of the Mandatory as integral portions of its territory, subject to the safeguards above mentioned in the interests of the indigenous population. In every case of mandate, the Mandatory shall render to the Council an annual report in reference to the territory committed to its charge. The degree of authority, control, or administration to be exercised by the Mandatory shall, if not previously agreed upon by the Members of the League, be explicitly defined in each case by the Council. A permanent Commission shall be constituted to receive and examine the annual reports of the Mandatories and to advise the Council on all matters relating to the observance of the mandates. ARTICLE 23. Subject to and in accordance with the provisions of international conventions existing or hereafter to be agreed upon, the Members of the League: (a) will endeavour to secure and maintain fair and humane conditions of labour for men, women, and children, both in their own countries and in all countries to which their commercial and industrial relations extend, and for that purpose will establish and maintain the necessary international organisations; (b) undertake to secure just treatment of the native inhabitants of territories under their control; (c) will entrust the League with the general supervision over the execution of agreements with regard to the traffic in women and children, and the traffic in opium and other dangerous drugs; (d) will entrust the League with the general supervision of the trade in arms and ammunition with the countries in which the control of this traffic is necessary in the common interest; (e) will make provision to secure and maintain freedom of communications and of transit and equitable treatment for the commerce of all Members of the League. In this connection, the special necessities of the regions devastated during the war of 1914-1918 shall be borne in mind; (f) will endeavour to take steps in matters of international concern for the prevention and control of disease. ARTICLE 24. There shall be placed under the direction of the League all international bureaux already established by general treaties if the parties to such treaties consent. All such international bureaux and all commissions for the regulation of matters of international interest hereafter constituted shall be placed under the direction of the League. In all matters of international interest which are regulated by general conventions but which are not placed under the control of international bureaux or commissions, the Secretariat of the League shall, subject to the consent of the Council and if desired by the parties, collect and distribute all relevant information and shall render any other assistance which may be necessary or desirable. The Council may include as part of the expenses of the Secretariat the expenses of any bureau or commission which is placed under the direction of the League. ARTICLE 25. The Members of the League agree to encourage and promote the establishment and co-operation of duly authorised voluntary national Red Cross organisations having as purposes the improvement of health, the prevention of disease, and the mitigation of suffering throughout the world. ARTICLE 26. Amendments to this Covenant will take effect when ratified by the Members of the League whose representatives compose the Council and by a majority of the Members of the League whose Representatives compose the Assembly. No such amendment shall bind any Member of the League which signifies its dissent therefrom, but in that case it shall cease to be a Memb,er of the League. ANNEX. I. ORIGINAL MEMRERS OF THE LEAGUE OF NATIONS SIGNATORIES OF THE TREATY OF PEACE. UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, BELGIUM, BOLIVIA, BRAZIL, BRITISH EUPIRE, CANADA, AUSTRALIA, SOUTH AFRICA, NEW ZEALAND, INDIA, CHINA, CUBA, ECUADOR, FRANCE, GREECE, GUATEMALA, HAITI, HEDJAZ, HONDURAS, ITALY, JAPAN, LIBERIA, NICARAGUA, PANAMA, PERU, POLAND, PORTUGAL, ROUMANIA, SERB-CROAT-SLOVENE STATE, SIAM, CZECHO-SLOVAKIA, URUGUAY STATES INVITED TO ACCEDE TO THE COVENANT. ARGENTINE REPUBLIC, CHILE, COLOMBIA, DENMARK, NETHERLANDS, NORWAY, PARAGUAY, PERSIA, SALVADOR, SPAIN, SWEDEN, SWITZERLAND, VENEZUELA. II. FIRST SECRETARY GENERAL OF THE LEAGUE OF NATION5. The Honourable Sir James Eric Drummond, K.C.M.G., C.B.
